title: Procedures with ICD-10-PCS
text: straightforward HCUP software tools included package Procedure Classes. Procedure classes identify procedures [1] diagnostic therapeutic [2] whether major (expected performed operating room) minor. function can vectorized (e.g. using dplyr::mutate) shown : Although applications using ICD-9 codes aren’t covered , function also works ICD-9 procedure codes.
code: library(hcup) classify_pr("0PS443Z") # Spine surgery #> [1] "Major Therapeutic" classify_pr("009U3ZX") # Lumbar puncture #> [1] "Minor Diagnostic" # Using the dplyr workflow library(dplyr) tibble(   Patients = c("A",       "B",       "C"),   ICD_10   = c("0PS443Z", "3E05305", "F13ZHZZ")) %>%   mutate(pr_class = classify_pr(ICD_10)) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   Patients ICD_10  pr_class          #>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>             #> 1 A        0PS443Z Major Therapeutic #> 2 B        3E05305 Minor Therapeutic #> 3 C        F13ZHZZ Minor Diagnostic classify_pr("0015") # Infusion of IL-2 #> [1] "Minor Therapeutic"

title: Procedures with ICD-10-PCS
text: Much powerful Clinical Classifications Software Refined (CCSR) categories, aggregates expansive number ICD-10-PCS procedure codes smaller number clinically meaningful categories. Similar procedure classes (functions starting classify_), categorizes ICD codes mutually exclusive categories. , can vectorized use within data frames. helper function explain_ccsr can convert categories human-readable labels. can also use “detailed” option within explain_ccsr(ccsr, detailed=TRUE) return additional data CCSR category. returns named list, can helpful conjunction purrr package.
code: classify_ccsr_pr("0016070") #> [1] "CNS010" library(dplyr) tibble(icd_10 = c("04L04DZ", "009Y40Z", "0F7C7DZ", "GZ2ZZZZ")) %>%   mutate(CCSR      = classify_ccsr_pr(icd_10),          explained = explain_ccsr(CCSR)) #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   icd_10  CCSR   explained                                                       #>   <chr>   <chr>  <chr>                                                           #> 1 04L04DZ CAR010 Ligation and embolization of vessels                            #> 2 009Y40Z CNS003 Spinal canal and spinal cord drainage (excluding lumbar punctu… #> 3 0F7C7DZ HEP008 Common bile duct sphincterotomy and stenting                    #> 4 GZ2ZZZZ MHT004 Crisis intervention for mental health library(purrr) # NOTE: The results returned when `detailed = TRUE` depends on the #       type of CCSR category. See the `CCSR_PR_categories` or  #       `CCSR_DX_categories` in the `hcup.data` package for details tibble(CCSR_PR = c("URN001", "RES010", "CAR004")) %>%   mutate(Explained = explain_ccsr(CCSR_PR),          details   = explain_ccsr(CCSR_PR, detailed = TRUE),          domain    = map_chr(details, "clinical_domain")) #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   CCSR_PR Explained                                      details   domain        #>   <chr>   <chr>                                          <list>    <chr>         #> 1 URN001  Cystoscopy and ureteroscopy (including biopsy) <chr [7]> Urinary Syst… #> 2 RES010  Tracheostomy                                   <chr [7]> Respiratory … #> 3 CAR004  Percutaneous coronary interventions (PCI)      <chr [7]> Cardiovascul…

title: Procedures with ICD-10-PCS
code: icd_pr_codes <- c("0PS443Z", "3E05305", "F13ZHZZ", "04L04DZ", "009Y40Z", "0F7C7DZ", "GZ2ZZZZ")  tibble(icd_pr10 = icd_pr_codes) %>%   mutate(CCSR      = classify_ccsr_pr(icd_pr_codes),          PR_cls    = classify_pr(icd_pr_codes),          explained = explain_ccsr(CCSR)) #> # A tibble: 7 × 4 #>   icd_pr10 CCSR   PR_cls            explained                                    #>   <chr>    <chr>  <chr>             <chr>                                        #> 1 0PS443Z  MST012 Major Therapeutic Bone fixation (excluding extremities)        #> 2 3E05305  ADM012 Minor Therapeutic Chemotherapy                                 #> 3 F13ZHZZ  ENT004 Minor Diagnostic  Diagnostic audiology                         #> 4 04L04DZ  CAR010 Major Therapeutic Ligation and embolization of vessels         #> 5 009Y40Z  CNS003 Major Therapeutic Spinal canal and spinal cord drainage (excl… #> 6 0F7C7DZ  HEP008 Major Therapeutic Common bile duct sphincterotomy and stenting #> 7 GZ2ZZZZ  MHT004 Minor Therapeutic Crisis intervention for mental health

what: Implementation of HCUP Software Tools in R
title: Implementation of HCUP Software Tools in R
text: Adapts software provided Healthcare Cost Utilization Project (HCUP) analyses administrative database using International Classification Diseases (ICD) codes within R statistical environment.

title: Implementation of HCUP Software Tools in R
text: can install development version hcup GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("HunterRatliff1/hcup")

title: Implementation of HCUP Software Tools in R
text: Although ’m fan procedures (clinical practice), aficionado ICD-10 procedure codes (ICD-10-PCS). Compared predecessor (ICD-9), ICD-10-PCS much eloquent specific, ’s appropriate start !

title: Implementation of HCUP Software Tools in R
text: straightforward HCUP software tools included package Procedure Classes. Procedure classes identify procedures [1] diagnostic therapeutic [2] whether major (expected performed operating room) minor. function can vectorized (e.g. using dplyr::mutate) shown : Although applications using ICD-9 codes aren’t covered , function also works ICD-9 procedure codes.
code: library(hcup) classify_pr("0PS443Z") # Spine surgery #> [1] "Major Therapeutic" classify_pr("009U3ZX") # Lumbar puncture #> [1] "Minor Diagnostic" # Using the dplyr workflow library(dplyr) tibble(   Patients = c("A",       "B",       "C"),   ICD_10   = c("0PS443Z", "3E05305", "F13ZHZZ")) %>%   mutate(pr_class = classify_pr(ICD_10)) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   Patients ICD_10  pr_class          #>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>             #> 1 A        0PS443Z Major Therapeutic #> 2 B        3E05305 Minor Therapeutic #> 3 C        F13ZHZZ Minor Diagnostic classify_pr("0015") # Infusion of IL-2 #> [1] "Minor Therapeutic"

title: Implementation of HCUP Software Tools in R
text: Much powerful Clinical Classifications Software Refined (CCSR) categories, aggregates expansive number ICD-10-PCS procedure codes smaller number clinically meaningful categories. Similar procedure classes (functions starting classify_), categorizes ICD codes mutually exclusive categories. , can vectorized use within data frames. helper function explain_ccsr can convert categories human-readable labels. can also use “detailed” option within explain_ccsr(ccsr, detailed=TRUE) return additional data CCSR category. returns named list, can helpful conjunction purrr package.
code: classify_ccsr_pr("0016070") #> [1] "CNS010" library(dplyr) tibble(icd_10 = c("04L04DZ", "009Y40Z", "0F7C7DZ", "GZ2ZZZZ")) %>%   mutate(CCSR      = classify_ccsr_pr(icd_10),          explained = explain_ccsr(CCSR)) #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   icd_10  CCSR   explained                                                       #>   <chr>   <chr>  <chr>                                                           #> 1 04L04DZ CAR010 Ligation and embolization of vessels                            #> 2 009Y40Z CNS003 Spinal canal and spinal cord drainage (excluding lumbar punctu… #> 3 0F7C7DZ HEP008 Common bile duct sphincterotomy and stenting                    #> 4 GZ2ZZZZ MHT004 Crisis intervention for mental health library(purrr) # NOTE: The results returned when `detailed = TRUE` depends on the #       type of CCSR category. See the `CCSR_PR_categories` or  #       `CCSR_DX_categories` in the `hcup.data` package for details tibble(CCSR_PR = c("URN001", "RES010", "CAR004")) %>%   mutate(Explained = explain_ccsr(CCSR_PR),          details   = explain_ccsr(CCSR_PR, detailed = TRUE),          domain    = map_chr(details, "clinical_domain")) #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   CCSR_PR Explained                                      details   domain        #>   <chr>   <chr>                                          <list>    <chr>         #> 1 URN001  Cystoscopy and ureteroscopy (including biopsy) <chr [7]> Urinary Syst… #> 2 RES010  Tracheostomy                                   <chr [7]> Respiratory … #> 3 CAR004  Percutaneous coronary interventions (PCI)      <chr [7]> Cardiovascul…

what: Identify CCSR categories for ICD-10-CM codes — ccsr_dx
title: Identify CCSR categories for ICD-10-CM codes — ccsr_dx
text: Given data.frame ICD-10-CM diagnosis codes, function appends column corresponding Clinical Classifications Software Refined (CCSR) categories, tidy format

title: Identify CCSR categories for ICD-10-CM codes — ccsr_dx
code: ccsr_dx(.data, dx_col)

title: Identify CCSR categories for ICD-10-CM codes — ccsr_dx
text: .data Data frame column named dx_col dx_col (unquoted) name column .data containing ICD-10-CM codes

title: Identify CCSR categories for ICD-10-CM codes — ccsr_dx
text: object type .data (.e. data.frame) columns .data. returned data.frame new column named CCSRcontaining CCSR categories assocaited ICD code dx_colcolumn. ICD codes multiple CCSR categories, multiple rows returned (longer, tidy format)

title: Identify CCSR categories for ICD-10-CM codes — ccsr_dx
text: Clinical Classifications Software Refined (CCSR) software provides one--one mapping (see classify_ccsr_dx1) one--many (see ccsr_dx) mapping ICD-10-CM diagnosis codes CCSR categories. one--many mapping necessary many ICD-10 codes span multiple meaningful categories, identification conditions related diagnosis code lost categorizing ICD-10-CM codes single category.

title: Identify CCSR categories for ICD-10-CM codes — ccsr_dx
text: example, consider code I11.0 (Hypertensive heart disease heart failure) encompasses heart failure (CCSR category CIR019) hypertension complications (CIR008). Classifying code heart failure alone miss meaningful information, hand, analyses require mutually exclusive categorization. function addresses identifying CCSR categories associated ICD code. example, consider data.frame ICD-10 code per row: corresponding CCSR codes two codes . Note K432 one CCSR category, A401 two. Running function patient 's two codes, results three rows A401 two categories (plus single row K432). See tidy data section R Data Science corresponding paper conceptual approach.

title: Identify CCSR categories for ICD-10-CM codes — ccsr_dx
text: numerous differences CCSR CCS (predecessor CCSR). CCS classifies codes multi-level categories hierarchical manner, allows users CCS use varying levels specificity classification (see classify_ccs), CCSR multiple classification levles. Additionally, CCSR classify codes mutually exclusive categories (ICD-10 diagnosis codes) categories used CCSR old categories used CCS. See Appendix CCSR user guide details differences CCSR CCS.

title: Identify CCSR categories for ICD-10-CM codes — ccsr_dx
code: library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(tibble) # for tribble fxn tibble::tribble(   ~pt_id,  ~ICD10,      "A",  "K432",      "A",  "A401") %>%   ccsr_dx(dx_col = ICD10) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   pt_id ICD10 CCSR   #>   <chr> <chr> <chr>  #> 1 A     K432  DIG010 #> 2 A     A401  INF002 #> 3 A     A401  INF003  df <-   tibble::tribble(   ~pt_id,  ~ICD10,   "A",     "K432",   "A",     "A401",   "B",     "I495",   "B",    "E8771",   "C",    "A5442",   "C",     "A564" ) df %>%  ccsr_dx(dx_col = ICD10) %>%  mutate(CCSR_expl = explain_ccsr(CCSR)) #> # A tibble: 9 × 4 #>   pt_id ICD10 CCSR   CCSR_expl                                                   #>   <chr> <chr> <chr>  <chr>                                                       #> 1 A     K432  DIG010 Abdominal hernia                                            #> 2 A     A401  INF002 Septicemia                                                  #> 3 A     A401  INF003 Bacterial infections                                        #> 4 B     I495  CIR017 Cardiac dysrhythmias                                        #> 5 B     E8771 END011 Fluid and electrolyte disorders                             #> 6 C     A5442 INF010 Sexually transmitted infections (excluding HIV and hepatit… #> 7 C     A5442 MUS001 Infective arthritis                                         #> 8 C     A564  INF010 Sexually transmitted infections (excluding HIV and hepatit… #> 9 C     A564  RSP006 Other specified upper respiratory infections

what: Classify codes into CCS categories — classify_ccs
title: Classify codes into CCS categories — classify_ccs
text: Converts vector ICD diagnosis codes vector Clinical Classifications Software (CCS) categories using HCUP's software

title: Classify codes into CCS categories — classify_ccs
code: classify_ccs(icd_codes, code_type, level = NULL)

title: Classify codes into CCS categories — classify_ccs
text: HCUP page CCS ICD-9 HCUP page CCS beta ICD-10

title: Classify codes into CCS categories — classify_ccs
text: icd_codes Vector ICD codes, without decimals code_type One "dx9", "dx10", "pr9", "pr10", corresponding type version ICD codes used level level CCS use. default use single-level CCS category

title: Classify codes into CCS categories — classify_ccs
text: Unlike CCS (CCS Refined), original CCS classification "single-level" "multi-level" categories. system classifies diagnoses procedures unique groups. single-level CCS aggregates diagnoses 285 mutually exclusive categories procedures 231 mutually exclusive categories. multi-level CCS expands single-level CCS hierarchical system. multi-level system four levels diagnoses three levels procedures, provide opportunity examine general groupings assess specific conditions procedures. multi-level CCS groups single-level CCS categories broader body systems condition categories (e.g., "Diseases Circulatory System," "Mental Disorders," "Injury"). example using CCS diagnosis codes shown : also splits single-level CCS categories provide detail. example, single-level CCS diagnosis category 4 (Mycoses) can split 1.2.1 (Candidiasis mouth) 1.2.2 (mycoses). details can found CCS fact sheet.

title: Classify codes into CCS categories — classify_ccs
text: notation used original CCS categories limitations names categories. First, CCS category CCS = '3' maps "bacterial infections" diagnostic codes, category (CCS = '3') maps "Laminectomy" procedures. Second, CCS category supposed treated string (HCUP designs software SAS), R appropriately assume categories numbers. third issue ambiguity single-level multi-level CCS categories. original software, first level multi-level CCS uses syntax single-level categories. example, "4" represents "Mycoses" single-level category, maps "Diseases blood blood-forming organs" multi-level category! turns incredibly confusing number "3" represent: "bacterial infections" single-level category diagnosis "Endocrine; nutritional; metabolic diseases immunity disorders" multi-level category diagnosis "Laminectomy" single-level category procedure "Operations eye" multi-level category procedure

title: Classify codes into CCS categories — classify_ccs
text: address issues, package prepends "DX" "PR" default CCS category (e.g. 3 becomes DX3 PR3 diagnoses procedures, respectively). multi-level categories, prefixes "DX-" "PR-". Although trivial change applications, mentioned (purposes reproducibility) notation changed back original format publications uses beyond package.

what: Classify principal diagnosis into CCSR category — classify_ccsr_dx1
title: Classify principal diagnosis into CCSR category — classify_ccsr_dx1
text: Converts vector ICD-10 principal diagnosis codes default Clinical Classifications Software Refined (CCSR) category based inpatient outpatient setting

title: Classify principal diagnosis into CCSR category — classify_ccsr_dx1
code: classify_ccsr_dx1(icd_10_dx1, setting = NULL)

title: Classify principal diagnosis into CCSR category — classify_ccsr_dx1
text: icd_10_dx1 vector principal ICD diagnosis codes (without decimals) setting Either "inpatient", (default) "outpatient" Note single default CCSR category applies principal diagnosis (inpatient) first-listed diagnosis (outpatient). can also abbreviated "ip" "op".

title: Classify principal diagnosis into CCSR category — classify_ccsr_dx1
text: vector default CCSR categories

title: Classify principal diagnosis into CCSR category — classify_ccsr_dx1
text: Clinical Classifications Software Refined (CCSR) software provides one--one mapping (see classify_ccsr_dx1) one--many (see ccsr_dx) mapping ICD-10-CM diagnosis codes CCSR categories. one--many mapping necessary many ICD-10 codes span multiple meaningful categories, identification conditions related diagnosis code lost categorizing ICD-10-CM codes single category. example, consider code I11.0 (Hypertensive heart disease heart failure) encompasses heart failure (CCSR category CIR019) hypertension complications (CIR008). Classifying code heart failure alone miss meaningful information, hand, analyses require mutually exclusive categorization. CCSR accomplishes providing "default" CCSR category based principal diagnosis (inpatient data) first-listed diagnosis (outpatient data); see page 16 CCSR DX user guide details. function addresses identifying default CCSR category based principal/first-listed diagnosis. applications utilizing ICD-10-CM codes, risk adjustment identification comorbidities, please use ccsr_dx function.

title: Classify principal diagnosis into CCSR category — classify_ccsr_dx1
code: classify_ccsr_dx1("I110", setting = "inpatient") #> `setting = inpatient` only applies to the principal/first listed diagnosis #> This message is displayed once every 8 hours. #> [1] "CIR019"  library(dplyr) dplyr::tibble(ICD10 = c("G4730", "L563", "A001")) %>%   mutate(CCSR_ip = classify_ccsr_dx1(ICD10, setting="inpatient"),          CCSR_op = classify_ccsr_dx1(ICD10, setting="outpatient")) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   ICD10 CCSR_ip CCSR_op #>   <chr> <chr>   <chr>   #> 1 G4730 NVS016  NVS016  #> 2 L563  SKN007  SKN007  #> 3 A001  DIG001  DIG001

text: vector CCSR categories procedures

title: Classify ICD-10-PCS procedures into CCSR a category — classify_ccsr_pr
code: classify_ccsr_pr("0016070") #> [1] "CNS010"  icd_10_pr <- c("04L04DZ", "009Y40Z", "0F7C7DZ", "GZ2ZZZZ") classify_ccsr_pr(icd_10_pr) #> [1] "CAR010" "CNS003" "HEP008" "MHT004"  # Vectorized using `mutate()` library(dplyr)  dplyr::tibble(icd_10 = icd_10_pr) %>%   mutate(CCSR = classify_ccsr_pr(icd_10),          explained = explain_ccsr(CCSR)) #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   icd_10  CCSR   explained                                                       #>   <chr>   <chr>  <chr>                                                           #> 1 04L04DZ CAR010 Ligation and embolization of vessels                            #> 2 009Y40Z CNS003 Spinal canal and spinal cord drainage (excluding lumbar punctu… #> 3 0F7C7DZ HEP008 Common bile duct sphincterotomy and stenting                    #> 4 GZ2ZZZZ MHT004 Crisis intervention for mental health

what: Classify ICD diagnosis codes into Chronic Condition Indicator categories — classify_chronic
title: Classify ICD diagnosis codes into Chronic Condition Indicator categories — classify_chronic
text: Converts vector ICD diagnosis codes vector Chronic Condition Indicator (CCI) categories using HCUP's software

title: Classify ICD diagnosis codes into Chronic Condition Indicator categories — classify_chronic
code: classify_chronic(icd_dx, icd_version)

title: Classify ICD diagnosis codes into Chronic Condition Indicator categories — classify_chronic
text: HCUP page CCI ICD-9 HCUP page CCI ICD-10

title: Classify ICD diagnosis codes into Chronic Condition Indicator categories — classify_chronic
text: icd_dx vector ICD diagnosis codes (without decimals) icd_version version ICD codes used. Can either ICD-10 (icd_version = 10) ICD-9 (icd_version = 9)

title: Classify ICD diagnosis codes into Chronic Condition Indicator categories — classify_chronic
text: vector CCI classifications. levels returned depend version ICD codes. See Details section

title: Classify ICD diagnosis codes into Chronic Condition Indicator categories — classify_chronic
text: Starting v2021.1 (beta version), CCI tool ICD-10-CM expanded identify four types conditions. Therefore, running function icd_version = 10 categorize ICD-10-CM codes one four conditions : Acute: Examples include aortic embolism, bacterial infection, pregnancy, initial encounter injury Chronic: Examples include malignant cancer, diabetes, obesity, hypertension, many mental health conditions : Examples include persistent asthma (acute) exacerbation, acute chronic heart failure, kidney transplant rejection Applicable: Examples include external cause morbidity codes, injury sequela codes, codes starting letter Z screening observation previous version (using ICD-9-CM), CCI classified conditions Chronic NonChronic, caution used appying CCI data using ICD-9 ICD-10.

title: Classify ICD diagnosis codes into Chronic Condition Indicator categories — classify_chronic
code: ## Take an ICD dx code and return the CCI classify_chronic(icd_dx = "G4730", icd_version = 10) #> [1] "Chronic" classify_chronic(icd_dx = "56081", icd_version = 9) #> [1] "NonChronic"  # Vectorized version icd_codes <- c("G4730", "L563", "M25151") classify_chronic(icd_codes, icd_version = 10) #> [1] "Chronic" "Acute"   "Acute"    # This works well in the dplyr workflow library(dplyr) pt_data <- tibble(   Patients = c("A",     "B",    "C"),   ICD_10   = c("G4730", "L563", "M25151") )  pt_data %>%   mutate(CCI = classify_chronic(ICD_10, icd_version = 10)) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   Patients ICD_10 CCI     #>   <chr>    <chr>  <chr>   #> 1 A        G4730  Chronic #> 2 B        L563   Acute   #> 3 C        M25151 Acute

title: Classify Procedure Classes — classify_pr
text: Converts vector ICD procedure codes vector Procedure Classes (ICD-9) Procedure Classes Refined (ICD-10) using HCUP's software

title: Classify Procedure Classes — classify_pr
code: classify_pr(icd_pr)

title: Classify Procedure Classes — classify_pr
text: HCUP page Procedure Classes ICD-9 HCUP page Procedure Classes Refined ICD-10

title: Classify Procedure Classes — classify_pr
text: icd_pr vector ICD-9-CM ICD-10-PCS codes procedures. need specify codes ICD-9 ICD-10.

title: Classify Procedure Classes — classify_pr
text: vector Procedure Classes, falling one four categories listed details section

title: Classify Procedure Classes — classify_pr
text: HCUP classifies procedures following four categories: Minor Diagnostic: Nonoperating room procedures diagnostic Minor Therapeutic: Nonoperating room procedures therapeutic Major Diagnostic: Procedures considered operating room procedures performed diagnostic reasons Major Therapeutic: Procedures considered operating room procedures performed therapeutic reasons

title: Classify Procedure Classes — classify_pr
text: tested extensively ICD-9 codes practice, users experiencing difficulty may want implement solutions. Please see ?hcup.data::proc_class_icd9 data used , use data(proc_class_icd9) adjust needs.

title: Classify Procedure Classes — classify_pr
code: classify_pr("00993ZX") #> [1] "Minor Diagnostic" classify_pr("0015") #> [1] "Minor Therapeutic"  # Using the dplyr workflow library(dplyr) pt_data <- tibble(   Patients = c("A",       "B",       "C"),   ICD_10   = c("0PS443Z", "3E05305", "F13ZHZZ") )  pt_data %>%   mutate(pr_class = classify_pr(ICD_10)) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   Patients ICD_10  pr_class          #>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>             #> 1 A        0PS443Z Major Therapeutic #> 2 B        3E05305 Minor Therapeutic #> 3 C        F13ZHZZ Minor Diagnostic  if (FALSE) { # Set of wrapper functions can be helpful for filtering is_diagnostic_pr("F13ZHZZ") is_major_pr("0PS443Z")  pt_data %>% filter(is_therapeutic_pr(ICD_10)) }

what: Look up CCS codes descriptions — explain_ccs
title: Look up CCS codes descriptions — explain_ccs
text: Look CCS codes descriptions

title: Look up CCS codes descriptions — explain_ccs
code: explain_ccs(ccs, detailed = FALSE)

title: Look up CCS codes descriptions — explain_ccs
text: ccs Vector CCS codes explained. Can mix diagnosis /procedure CCS groups. detailed Single logical value indicates details returned. default FALSE, case description CCS category returned. set TRUE, return list named character vectors

title: Look up CCS codes descriptions — explain_ccs
code: # Explain the CCS for diagnosis categories explain_ccs("DX37") #> [1] "Hodgkin`s disease"  # The same function works for procedures explain_ccsr("PR28") #> character(0)  # Vectorized using `mutate()` library(dplyr) dplyr::tibble(   CCS = c("DX37", "PR28", "PR-5.6", "DX-9.6.3"),   Type = c("DX", "PR", "PR", "DX")) %>% mutate(explained = explain_ccs(CCS)) #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   CCS      Type  explained                                                       #>   <chr>    <chr> <chr>                                                           #> 1 DX37     DX    Hodgkin`s disease                                               #> 2 PR28     PR    Plastic procedures on nose                                      #> 3 PR-5.6   PR    Other non-OR therapeutic procedures on nose; mouth and pharynx… #> 4 DX-9.6.3 DX    Intestinal obstruction without hernia [145.]

what: Look up CCSR codes descriptions — explain_ccsr
title: Look up CCSR codes descriptions — explain_ccsr
text: Look CCSR codes descriptions

title: Look up CCSR codes descriptions — explain_ccsr
code: explain_ccsr(ccsr, detailed = FALSE)

title: Look up CCSR codes descriptions — explain_ccsr
text: ccsr Vector CCSR codes explained. Can mix diagnosis /procedure CCSR groups. detailed Single logical value indicates details returned. default FALSE, case description CCSR category returned. set TRUE, return list named character vectors

title: Look up CCSR codes descriptions — explain_ccsr
code: # Explain the CCSR for diagnosis categories explain_ccsr("SKN003") #> [1] "Pressure ulcer of skin"  # The same function works for procedures explain_ccsr("LYM007") #> [1] "Bone marrow biopsy"  # Vectorized using `mutate()` library(dplyr) dplyr::tibble(   CCSR = c("NVS011", "DIG021", "MBD028", "URN001", "RES010", "CAR004"),   Type = c("DX", "DX", "DX", "PR", "PR", "PR")) %>% mutate(explained = explain_ccsr(CCSR)) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   CCSR   Type  explained                                      #>   <chr>  <chr> <chr>                                          #> 1 NVS011 DX    Neurocognitive disorders                       #> 2 DIG021 DX    Gastrointestinal hemorrhage                    #> 3 MBD028 DX    Opioid-related disorders; subsequent encounter #> 4 URN001 PR    Cystoscopy and ureteroscopy (including biopsy) #> 5 RES010 PR    Tracheostomy                                   #> 6 CAR004 PR    Percutaneous coronary interventions (PCI)       # Example using the detailed option library(purrr) tibble(CCSR_PR = c("URN001", "RES010", "CAR004")) %>%   mutate(Explained = explain_ccsr(CCSR_PR),          details   = explain_ccsr(CCSR_PR, detailed = TRUE),          domain    = map_chr(details, "clinical_domain")) #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   CCSR_PR Explained                                      details   domain        #>   <chr>   <chr>                                          <list>    <chr>         #> 1 URN001  Cystoscopy and ureteroscopy (including biopsy) <chr [7]> Urinary Syst… #> 2 RES010  Tracheostomy                                   <chr [7]> Respiratory … #> 3 CAR004  Percutaneous coronary interventions (PCI)      <chr [7]> Cardiovascul…

what: hcup: Implementation of HCUP Software Tools in R — hcup-package
title: hcup: Implementation of HCUP Software Tools in R — hcup-package
text: Adapts software provided Healthcare Cost Utilization Project (HCUP) analyses administrative database using International Classification Diseases (ICD) codes within R statistical environment.

title: hcup: Implementation of HCUP Software Tools in R — hcup-package
text: Maintainer: Hunter Ratliff hunterratliff.cv@gmail.com (ORCID)
